unnormalised: Just In: Confusion reigns supreme as the Great Indian Festival Calendar™ throws another curveball! Sources say Diwali 2024 is *officially* happening on both 31/10/2024 *and* 01/11/2024. Panditji couldn't be reached for comment, presumably because he's busy consulting the cosmic algorithm.
normalised: just in: confusion reigns supreme as the great indian festival calendar trademark throws another curveball! sources say Diwali two thousand and twenty four is officially happening on both thirty first october two thousand and twenty four and first november two thousand and twenty four. panditji couldn't be reached for comment, presumably because he's busy consulting the cosmic algorithm.

unnormalised: Citizens are reportedly stockpiling sweets and firecrackers *just in case*. "Better safe than sorry," quipped Mrs. Sharma from Delhi, already sporting her festive saree, "What if Lakshmiji shows up on the *wrong* day? We'd be doomed!"
normalised: citizens are reportedly stockpiling sweets and firecrackers just in case. "better safe than sorry," quipped misses sharma from delhi, already sporting her festive saree, "what if Lakshmiji shows up on the wrong day? we'd be doomed!"

unnormalised: Meanwhile, travel agencies are offering *double* the discounts on flights home, because, let's face it, no one actually knows when the *real* holiday is. "Book now, celebrate later!" shouts the banner ad, which probably should include a disclaimer.
normalised: meanwhile, travel agencies are offering double the discounts on flights home, because, let's face it, no one actually knows when the real holiday is. "book now, celebrate later!" shouts the banner ad, which probably should include a disclaimer.

unnormalised: Adding to the chaos, meteorologists predict a "possible rain event" between 10:00 AM and 4:00 PM on *both* days. So, alongside your diyas, don’t forget your umbrellas!
normalised: adding to the chaos, meteorologists predict a "possible rain event" between ten a m and four p m on both days. so, alongside your diyas, don’t forget your umbrellas!

unnormalised: The government has announced a 5-day "Festival Buffer Zone" from 29/10/2024 to 02/11/2024, declaring it a "no work, only party" zone. Consider it a preemptive apology for the inevitable date discrepancies. Stay tuned for further updates as we navigate this festive frenzy!
normalised: the government has announced a five day "festival buffer zone" from twenty ninth october two thousand and twenty four to second november two thousand and twenty four, declaring it a "no work, only party" zone. consider it a preemptive apology for the inevitable date discrepancies. stay tuned for further updates as we navigate this festive frenzy!
